function: Fetch dynamic data from backend APIs for contest browsing, enrollment, question display, answer submission, scoring, and leaderboard.
static_description: The frontend application displays contest listings, question interfaces, score dashboards, and leaderboards dynamically fetched from backend endpoints. All components use beige (#F5F5DC) as the base background color and saddle brown (#8B4513) for buttons, headers, borders, and active states.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a contest card navigates to the contest detail page which loads questions via API.
Clicking 'Enroll' on a contest triggers an API call to register the user in the selected contest.
Submitting an answer sends the response to the backend and fetches updated scoring information.
Scrolling through the leaderboard updates only visible entries without reloading entire dataset.

function: Establish connection to PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables and manage CRUD operations for users, contests, questions, answers, and leaderboard data.
static_description: Backend connects securely to PostgreSQL instance using DB_HOST, DB_PORT, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD, and DB_NAME environment variables. It exposes RESTful APIs for managing contest-related entities.

function: Manage user authentication and maintain secure sessions during contest participation.
static_description: Login and signup pages allow users to authenticate. Upon successful login, JWT tokens are stored in cookies or localStorage. Session timeouts occur after 2 hours of inactivity.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Login' validates credentials and redirects authenticated users to the home screen.
Clicking 'Logout' clears session tokens and returns user to the login page.

resource_dependency.contest_card_component: Reusable card component with title, description, start/end times, and enroll button

function: Display a list of available knowledge competitions that users can browse.
static_description: A grid or list layout presents open contests with titles, descriptions, start/end times, and default images. Each entry includes an 'Enroll Now' button styled with saddle brown.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a contest card navigates to its detail page.
Clicking 'Enroll Now' enrolls the current user in the contest.

function: Allow users to join available contests by registering their interest.
static_description: Each contest listing shows either an 'Enroll Now' button or 'Already Enrolled' status depending on the user's registration. Buttons are colored saddle brown.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Enroll Now' calls the backend API to register the user in the contest and changes the button to 'Already Enrolled'.

resource_dependency.question_display_container: Single-question view container with timer, options, and navigation controls

function: Present contest questions one at a time with clear formatting and intuitive navigation.
static_description: Displays one question per screen with multiple-choice options or free-text input field. Includes a countdown timer icon and navigation buttons ('Next', 'Submit') styled in saddle brown.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Next' advances to the next question in sequence.
Clicking 'Submit' submits all remaining answers and ends the quiz.

function: Enable users to submit answers to displayed contest questions.
static_description: Multiple-choice questions show radio buttons or checkboxes. Free-text questions provide a text area. Submit button appears below each question in saddle brown styling.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Submit Answer' sends the selected option(s) or typed text to the backend and proceeds to the next question or summary screen.

resource_dependency.scoring_algorithm_logic: Calculated based on correct answers and submission speed
resource_dependency.score_display_format: Points out of total possible points

function: Calculate and update user scores instantly upon answer submission.
static_description: Score panel updates automatically after each submitted answer. Displays total earned points versus maximum possible, along with time-based bonuses if applicable.

resource_dependency.score_chart_visualization: Bar chart or line graph showing performance over time
resource_dependency.contest_history_section: List of past contests with scores and ranks

function: Provide personalized insights into user performance across enrolled contests.
static_description: Dashboard features a score overview chart, rank badge indicating standing, and a history section listing previous contests with corresponding scores and rankings. Background is beige with saddle brown accents.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a contest in the history section reveals detailed results and feedback.

function: Showcase top performers within each contest to encourage competition.
static_description: Leaderboard lists top scorers with position numbers, usernames, and scores. Top three entries receive gold/silver/bronze badges. Refreshes periodically every 30 seconds.

interaction_and_states.description: Scrolling down loads more ranked participants beyond initial top 10.

resource_dependency.peer_comparison_visual: Side-by-side bar graphs comparing user vs average/top scores

function: Allow users to compare their performance against peers in the same contest.
static_description: Comparison view overlays user’s score against average and top scores using visual charts. Displays percentile ranking message such as 'You're in the top 15%' beneath the graph.

function: Ensure consistent UI design with beige backgrounds and saddle brown components across devices.
static_description: All screens utilize beige (#F5F5DC) as the primary background color and saddle brown (#8B4513) for buttons, headers, links, and active states. Layout adjusts responsively between mobile, tablet, and desktop views.

resource_dependency.install_all_script: concurrently "cd client && npm install" "cd server && npm install"

function: Configure package.json to support installing dependencies for both frontend and backend applications simultaneously.
static_description: Root package.json defines an 'install:all' script that executes npm install commands in both ./client and ./server directories concurrently.

resource_dependency.dev_start_script: concurrently "cd client && npm run dev" "cd server && npm run dev"

function: Define a development startup command that launches both frontend and backend services together.
static_description: Root package.json contains a 'dev' script utilizing the concurrently library to launch client-side and server-side development servers at once.

resource_dependency.database_schema_definition: CREATE TABLE users(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE NOT NULL, email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL, password_hash TEXT NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()); CREATE TABLE contests(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, title VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, description TEXT, start_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL, end_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL); CREATE TABLE questions(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, contest_id UUID REFERENCES contests(id), question_text TEXT NOT NULL, question_type VARCHAR(20) CHECK(question_type IN ('multiple_choice', 'free_text')), options JSONB); CREATE TABLE answers(id UUID PRIMARY KEY, user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id), contest_id UUID REFERENCES contests(id), question_id UUID REFERENCES questions(id), answer_text TEXT, is_correct BOOLEAN, submitted_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()); CREATE TABLE leaderboard(contest_id UUID REFERENCES contests(id), user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id), score INTEGER NOT NULL, rank SERIAL, PRIMARY KEY(contest_id, user_id));

function: Establish database tables for storing user accounts, contest metadata, contest questions, submitted answers, and calculated leaderboard rankings.
static_description: PostgreSQL schema includes five main tables: users, contests, questions, answers, and leaderboard. Relationships are enforced via foreign keys ensuring referential integrity.
